skill.name: agent-browser
skill.description: Automates browser interactions for web testing, form filling, screenshots, and data extraction. Use when the user needs to navigate websites, interact with web pages, fill forms, take screenshots, test web applications, or extract information from web pages.
skill.summary: Automates browser interactions for web testing, form filling, screenshots, and data extraction.
skill.author: vercel-labs

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected patterns typical of browser automation tools. The 322 findings across external commands, network access, and filesystem operations are consistent with legitimate Playwright-based browser automation functionality. Shell commands invoke browser CLI tools (chromium, xdg-open) for navigation, form interaction, and screenshot capture. No evidence of malicious intent or data exfiltration patterns. Risk level elevated to medium due to the inherent capabilities of browser automation skills.

medium_findings.title: External Command Execution in Documentation
medium_findings.description: Documentation files contain examples of shell command invocations including backtick execution and command substitution patterns. These are legitimate documentation examples for browser automation, not actual executable code.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: These are documentation examples in markdown files that cannot be executed. The patterns describe legitimate browser automation operations.

medium_findings.title: Shell Command Invocation in Templates
medium_findings.description: Shell script templates invoke external commands for browser automation. Commands include chromium-browser, xdg-open, and system utilities for file operations.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Shell templates contain actual command invocations for browser automation. These are legitimate Playwright-based automation patterns.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded URLs in Documentation
low_findings.description: Documentation references contain hardcoded URLs for testing endpoints and example sites.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Hardcoded URLs in documentation are static examples and pose no security risk.

low_findings.title: Proxy Configuration Documentation
low_findings.description: Documentation includes proxy environment variable references and SOCKS proxy examples.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Proxy documentation describes legitimate configuration options for browser automation in corporate environments.

content.user_title: Automate browser tasks for testing and data extraction
content.value_statement: Web testing and form filling require repetitive browser interactions. This skill provides automated browser control for navigation, form submission, screenshot capture, and data extraction through a Playwright-based interface.
actual_capabilities: Navigate to URLs and wait for page load
Fill and submit web forms automatically
Save and restore browser sessions with authentication state
Record browser interactions as video for debugging
Handle proxy authentication and SOCKS proxies
limitations: Cannot execute JavaScript or evaluate expressions in page context
Cannot manage multiple browser windows or tabs simultaneously

use_cases.title: Automated web application testing
use_cases.description: Automate regression testing for web applications by navigating pages, filling forms, checking for errors, and capturing screenshots of test results.

use_cases.title: Form data population and submission
use_cases.description: Automate filling out long forms with provided data, useful for data entry tasks, registration processes, and form testing workflows.

use_cases.title: Visual bug report documentation
use_cases.description: Generate visual documentation of web pages including screenshots and video recordings of interactions for bug reports and workflow documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Simple page navigation and screenshot
prompt_templates.prompt: Navigate to {url} and take a full-page screenshot of the homepage. Save it as homepage.png.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to capture a screenshot of a specific web page

prompt_templates.title: Form automation with data
prompt_templates.prompt: Go to {url}. Fill the form with name: {name}, email: {email}, and message: {message}. Submit the form and capture the result page.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to fill out and submit a web form with user-provided data

prompt_templates.title: Session management with authentication
prompt_templates.prompt: Load the authenticated session from {session_file}. Navigate to {url} to verify the session is working. Take a screenshot showing you are logged in.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to resume a previous browser session with authentication

prompt_templates.title: Multi-step workflow recording
prompt_templates.prompt: Start video recording to {output_path}. Navigate through these steps: 1) Go to {start_url}, 2) Click the login button, 3) Fill credentials, 4) Submit. Stop recording when complete.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to record a browser workflow as video for documentation or debugging

output_examples.input: Navigate to example.com and take a screenshot
Fill contact form with test data and submit
output: Message: This is a test message

best_practices: Use explicit waits for page elements to ensure reliable form interactions across different page load speeds.
Save authenticated sessions to files for reuse across multiple browser automation runs.
Take screenshots at key points in workflows to aid debugging when issues occur.
anti_patterns: Do not assume elements are immediately available; always wait for selectors before interaction.
Avoid capturing sensitive data like passwords in screenshots or session files without encryption.
Do not attempt to automate complex JavaScript-heavy applications that require extensive client-side state management.

faq.question: What browsers are supported by this skill?
faq.answer: This skill supports Chromium-based browsers including Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, and Chromium browser itself. Firefox and WebKit support may be available depending on your Playwright installation.

faq.question: Can this skill execute JavaScript on web pages?
faq.answer: No, this skill does not provide direct JavaScript execution capabilities. It automates browser interactions through the Playwright API but cannot run arbitrary JavaScript in the page context.

faq.question: How are browser sessions saved and restored?
faq.answer: Browser sessions are saved using Playwright's storage state feature which captures cookies, local storage, and session storage. This allows you to restore authenticated sessions without re-logging in.

faq.question: Can this skill handle CAPTCHAs or bot detection?
faq.answer: No, this skill cannot bypass CAPTCHAs or sophisticated bot detection systems. These require human interaction or specialized services.

faq.question: How are screenshots and videos stored?
faq.answer: Screenshots and videos are saved to the file system at paths you specify. Videos are saved in WebM format. Ensure the output directory exists and is writable.

faq.question: Does this skill work with authenticated proxies?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports HTTP, HTTPS, and SOCKS5 proxies with authentication. You can configure proxy settings per browser context or globally.
